sample

Class DatabaseManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • sample.DatabaseManager

  • public class DatabaseManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages all database activity including connecting to the database and executing SQL statements.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.sql.Connection conn
      The connection to the database.
      private boolean isConnectedToDB
      Tracks if the program is connected to a database.
      private java.sql.PreparedStatement ps
      A prepared SQL statement to inject into the database.
      private java.lang.String pword
      Holds the password for the database connection.
      private java.sql.ResultSet rs
      An object to hold the results of a SQL query.
      private java.lang.String user
      Holds the user name for the database connection.

      Default constructor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DatabaseManager

        protected DatabaseManager(java.lang.String user,
                          java.lang.String pword)
        Default constructor. This accepts the username and password for a database connection, then stores those values in the class. Finally, it attempts to connect to the database.
        Parameters:
        user - Holds the username for the database
        pword - Holds the password for the database

    • Method Detail

      • getConnectionStatus

        boolean getConnectionStatus()
        Getter for the connection status.
        Returns:
        Returns a boolean that is true if connected to the database and false if not.

      • connectToDB

        private void connectToDB()
        Attempts to connect to the database.

      • createTable

        void createTable(java.lang.String tableName)
        Create a new table with the specified name. For now, this makes a predetermined table with 4 columns: id, name, manufacturer, and type.
        Parameters:
        tableName - Holds the name of the table to be accessed.

      • listRowsInProductsTable

        java.util.ArrayList<Product> listRowsInProductsTable()
        List all of the rows in the PRODUCTS table.
        Returns:
        ArrayList An ArrayList of Products that exist in the database.

      • listRowsInProductionTable

        java.util.ArrayList<Production> listRowsInProductionTable()
        List all of the rows in the PRODUCTION table.
        Returns:
        ArrayList An ArrayList of Productions that exist in the database.

      • insertRowIntoProductTable

        void insertRowIntoProductTable(int id,
                               java.lang.String name,
                               java.lang.String manufacturer,
                               java.lang.String type)
        Insert new rows into the PRODUCT table.
        Parameters:
        id - The unique ID number of the row entry.
        name - The name of the product in the row entry.
        manufacturer - The manufacturer of the product in the row entry.
        type - The "type" of the product in the row entry (see ItemType enum).

      • insertRowIntoProductionTable

        void insertRowIntoProductionTable(java.lang.String name,
                                  int quantity,
                                  java.util.Date manufacturedOn)
        Insert new rows into the PRODUCTION table.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the product in the row entry.
        quantity - The amount of products that were manufactured.
        manufacturedOn - The date and time the products were manufactured.

      • listColumnsInTable

        void listColumnsInTable(java.lang.String tableName)
        Retrieves and prints the columns names (and their data types) in a given table.
        Parameters:
        tableName - Holds the name of the table to be accessed.

      • disconnectFromDB

        void disconnectFromDB()
        Close all objects to tidy up.
